clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Evaluation of AboutFace: Novel Peer Education Resource for Veterans
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Evaluation of AboutFace: A Novel Peer Education Resource for Veterans

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the AboutFace peer education website for the purpose of reducing stigma and improving attitudes toward seeking mental health services among Veterans.

detailed_description.textblock: Research suggests that at least 1 in 10 Veterans will meet criteria for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) related to their military experience. Treatment is widely available to Veterans with PTSD, and national dissemination initiatives have increased Veterans' access to best practice interventions. However, treatment seeking remains strikingly low among Veterans with PTSD. In fact, most Veterans with PTSD do not seek mental health services due to perceived stigma and other associated barriers. The National Center for PTSD recently developed and launched AboutFace, a peer education resource for Veterans. The investigators of this study believe that AboutFace has tremendous potential to reduce stigma and improve attitudes toward seeking mental health services among Veterans. However, it has not yet been evaluated. Investigators have partnered with the National Center for PTSD to launch this mixed methods pilot evaluation of AboutFace.

primary_outcome.description: Ease of use for the the AboutFace website

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Attitudes and Barriers Toward Seeking Mental Health Services
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and Two weeks after consent
primary_outcome.description: The questions address perceptions of treatment effectiveness, stigma, and external barriers to treatment seeking.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and Two weeks after consent

secondary_outcome.description: This interview tool will allow data capture related to participants' opinions on the attractiveness, layout, and content of the AboutFace website.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At study visit immediately following the usability interview
secondary_outcome.description: This interview tool will be used to capture data related to satisfaction, knowledge change, and changes in attitude toward seeking mental health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Two Week Post Consent Follow Up Phone Interview
secondary_outcome.description: At the time of recruitment, a 2-week follow-up telephone assessment (see section D5d) will be scheduled with all participants in both conditions to assess stigma, attitudes toward seeking treatment, and - for participants in the AboutFace condition - reactions to AboutFace.

intervention.description: AboutFace is an informational website that utilizes digital storytelling to describe PTSD symptoms and treatment for PTSD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must be 18 years of age
- Recommended for PTSD treatment following evaluation
- Internet access
- English Speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Minors under the age of 18
- Non-Veterans
- Negative for PTSD
